3.231. 
Legal regime of property used jointly by cohabitants 
1. Where immovable property or rights thereto referred to in Article 3.230 of this Code are registered in the name of one of the cohabitants, both cohabitants may, at their joint request, direct the appropriate public register to make the necessary entry indicating that such property or rights thereto are used by the cohabitants. The authenticity of the signatures of the cohabitants in such a request shall be certified by a notary public. 
2. The cohabitants shall have the right to conclude a notarial agreement in which they determine the division of the property acquired and used jointly after the end of their cohabitation. The provisions of Articles 3.101 to 3.108 of this Code shall apply mutatis mutandis to such a contract.
